doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia

Fanlight Keystone from Owen Biddle, The Young Carpenters Assistant, 1810, and Asher Benjamin, The Rudiments of Architecture, 1814; Handrail, Chair rail, Mantels from Benjamin, The Country Builders Assistant, 1805; 1st Fl Architrave from Benjamins, Rudiments; Arch Keystone from Benjamins, The Practical House Carpenter, 1832--Ceiling Fans similar to Columbia in Fan Distict of Richmond; Stair Scroll Bracket similar to Clover Fields & Mount Fair; Arch with keystone similar to Clover Fields & Estouteville--2 Story Brick Addition: Original rear 2 Column Portico moved to new addition--Adj Gen Thomas Farish Home Custer here during Civil War http://poe.acc.virginia.edu/~mjb6g/farm/davis.htm--Thomas L Farish Home 1840--George R B Michie Home 1909--Hillcrest Nursing Home 1949--For more information and images see present owner Michael J. Bednar's URL Home Page: http://poe.acc.virginia.edu/~mjb6g/farm/davis.htm

2 Story Brick: 48'x42,' Paired Column Portico (front) & 2 Column Portico (rear), Pie Shaped Brick Columns, Chinese Railings, 3 Bay, 2 Pile, Center Passage not through house, Exterior Cornice had Dentils & Brackets, Flemish Bond, Queens Closers, Penciling,Bulkhead, Hipped Roof, Floor Insulation, Rectangular Banisters, Plaster Ceiling Fans, Fosse?, Dining Room Servants Door, 6 Panel Door, Fanlight with Sidelights, Triple Hung Sash, 6/6/6, 6/6, 6/6 with Jib, Blinds
William B Phillips? 1825-27--Michael Bednar & Jo Lawson, Architects 1994
survey data: Studies in Vernacular Architecture--Virginia Road Traces--Charlottesville's Historic Landmarks Study Surveys
The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
